text: i'm Aijit Singh I'm the senior
engineering manager at Adobe I manage
the teams for Genai and AI services We
power the intelligence capabilities for
Acrobat apps and Acrobat services APIs
We'll continue to innovate and excelate
the pace of our innovation to make sure
our users are able to get to the
insights they need from their documents
and turn them into actionable items So
we developed Acrobat AI assistant
starting with a very quick PC as with
any other software project Once we had
the P available to a set of early users
we were quickly able to see how it was
kind of changing the way they were
interacting with documents Once we were
confident of that value we started
building out for the scale that we need
of hundreds of millions of users We used
AWS extensively to build for that scale
We relied heavily on Amazon open search
We were able to deliver one of our core
capabilities of attributions using
attribution citations using open search
And second we very recently started
using Amazon Bedrock to extend our
Acrobat AI assistant to non English
speakers That has helped us reach out to
a larger user base of Acrobat After we
rolled out we had a great response from
our users and we are continuing to
expand on our capabilities for our user
base There are trillions of PDFs
documents out there and we were able to
have people get to the actionable items
very quickly So effectively getting
people to what they want to do as soon
as possible
